DOC.brief_title: Non-Surgical Treatment Approaches Patients With Newly Diagnosed Lateral Epicondylitis : A Randomized Clinical Trial
DOC.detailed_description: Lateral epicondylitis ( tennis elbow ) painful musculoskeletal condition , consider due overuse , over-stress over-exertion wrist extensor forearm , especially extensor carpus radialis brevi . Different treatment approach describe literature . The primary aim treatment approach decrease pain improve functional level patient lateral epicondylitis . Thus , decrease pain regain functional performance daily living activity essential early diagnose patient . The aim study compare short-term effect different treatment approach pain , function grip strength rehabilitation patient lateral epicondylitis .
DOC.criteria: diagnose tennis elbow , duration symptom 8 10 week , pain lateral epicondyle , pain grip strength testing , pain one follow test : extensor carpus radialis test ( i.e. , resist middlefinger extension ) , resist wrist extension , passive stretch wrist extensor . Furthermore , participant agree abstain form treatment involvement study patient inflammatory , autoimmune , endocrine kidney disease , cubital tunnel syndrome , carpal tunnel syndrome , radiculopathies due cervical disc pathology , additional shoulderhandwrist pathology , inflammatory arthritis , upper extremity operation traumas , allergy adhesive tape , patient receive corticosteroid injection due lateral epicondylitis within last 3 month
